page.title: 11A DAY OF WORK
page.content: Our family is a patient family. My Mother Christine is a nice person. She has a lot of knowledge and is especially good at maths. My father is better at English. My sister Andrea is ready to do anything. At the moment I am nine and in the third year at Wellacre Junior School. My Teacher is Mrs. Drummond and the Head Teacher is mr. Pears. Each day I eat cornflakes, probably made in Trafford Park near to Proctor and Gamble, where my Mum works in an office. They make "Head and Shoulders" shampoo and "Pampers" baby nappies. Once my Mum has gone to work my Dad gets up and we go to our Grandma's. Dad then goes to work at Shell Chemicals in Carrington and my sister goes to Urmston Grammar school. I go to school at half past eight and play with my best friend, Nicholas Seth. His ancestors may be alive now.
